carl.abr.threads

Class IOIO_thread

  • java.lang.Object
    • ioio.lib.util.BaseIOIOLooper
      • carl.abr.threads.IOIO_thread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ioio.lib.util.IOIOLooper

    public class IOIO_thread
extends ioio.lib.util.BaseIOIOLooper
    Class (thread) used to open pins of the IOIO, as well as read IR values, and send pwm signals to the servo and motor of the robot.
    The main loop of the thread is executed in {static final int MIN_PWM_MOTOR = 1500;. Values of the IR sensors can be accessed using get_IR_values(). The pulse width of the PWM signals sent to the motor and servo signal are set using set_PWM_values(float, float).
    See Also:
    #loop()} , {@link #get_IR_values()}, {@link #set_PWM_values(float, float)} , {@link #setup()} , {@link #set_inverted(boolean)}

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IOIO_thread(int d_servo, int d_motor)
      Constructor
      Sets min, max and default pwm pulse witdh for motor and servo (sent by server)

      • loop

        public void loop()
          throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Main loop of the thread. Reads values of analog inputs (e.g. IR sensors), calls Object.wait(), then sets pulse width of PWM outputs.
        When wait() is called, the thread pauses and waits to be awaken by the main thread that will call set_PWM_values(float, float) which calls Object.notify().
        Specified by:
        loop in interface ioio.lib.util.IOIOLooper
        Overrides:
        loop in class ioio.lib.util.BaseIOIOLooper
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        See Also:
        #wait()} , {@link #set_PWM_values(float, float)} , {@link #notify()}

      • get_IR_values

        public float[] get_IR_values()
        Get the new values from the IR sensors
        Parameters:
        float[5] - : normalized values [0;1] of the IR sensors
        null : if IR values have already been accessed

      • set_PWM_values

        public void set_PWM_values(float pwm_motor,
                  float pwm_servo)
        Sets pulse width of the PWM signals of the motor and servo, then calls Object.notify() to awake the ioio thread.
        Parameters:
        pwm_motor - : pulse width of the PWM signal controlling the motor
        pwm_servo - : pulse width of the PWM signal controlling the servo
        See Also:
        #wait()} , {@link #loop()} , {@link #notify()}

      • set_inverted

        public void set_inverted(boolean inv)
        Set inverted pwm commands
        Parameters:
        inv - : true to inverse pwm pulse width around 1500 (e.g. 1000 becomes 2000, and 2000 becomes 1000)
